title: Bug 13725: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
description:
When performing the steps below, the 'Revert' option in the editor takes significantly longer time compared to closing and reopening the file in the java editor:

1. Answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog.
2. Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.

However, if I repeat steps 1) and 2), and then select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes approximately 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original content.
OB: When selecting 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor after repeating steps 1) and 2), it takes approximately 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original content.
EB: Reverting the file in the java editor should take a similar amount of time as closing and reopening the file.
SR:
1. Open a file in the java editor.
2. Make changes to the file.
3. Answer 'no' when prompted to save changes.
4. Close the file.
5. Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.
6. Repeat steps 3) to 5).
7. Select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor.

Expected result: The contents of the window should be replaced with the original content within a reasonable amount of time, similar to closing and reopening the file.
